benchmark_details.name: AltChart
benchmark_details.overview: AltChart is a dataset comprising 10,000 real chart images, each paired with comprehensive summaries featuring long-context and semantically rich annotations, aimed at enhancing accessibility for blind and visually impaired individuals.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rich dataset for chart summarization tasks that enhances accessibility for blind and visually impaired individuals.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite having diverse chart categories, the model still tends to hallucinate and produce factually incorrect statements, particularly with complex charts.

data.source: Collected from HCI publications across five ACM conferences (CHI, ASSETS, DIS, UIST, W4A) from 2015 to 2023.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts for semantically rich descriptions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the semantic similarity and informativeness of generated summaries compared to human-authored summaries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating accurate and comprehensive chart summaries.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated by rigorous manual checks on a subset of the images to ensure adherence to accessibility guidelines.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset aims to improve accessibility for blind and visually impaired individuals, fostering inclusive data representation.
